ch.epfl.alpano

Interface Preconditions


  • public interface Preconditions
    Preconditions are used to check if the boolean argument is true.

    If the boolean passed is false then the precondition is not met and a new IllegalArgumentException is thrown. The use of this interface allows for a more esthetic way to check and create IllegalArguemtnException when needed.

    Author:
    Martin Cibils (261746), Jeremy Mion (261178)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void checkArgument(boolean b)
      Checks if the boolean condition is met.
      static void checkArgument(boolean b, java.lang.String message)
      Checks if the boolean condition is met.

    • Method Detail

      • checkArgument

        static void checkArgument(boolean b)
        Checks if the boolean condition is met. If the condition is not true the and error will be created.
        Parameters:
        b - Boolean condition to check.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if b doesn't evaluate to true.

      • checkArgument

        static void checkArgument(boolean b,
                          java.lang.String message)
        Checks if the boolean condition is met. If the condition is not met it will create an error and join the message to it.
        Parameters:
        b - The condition that must be true to not create an error.
        message - To be added to the error if b is false.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - with message if b evaluates to false.
